name: Peach Me
preparation:
“Peach goes well with orange, ginger and vanilla to complement these flavors and bring out the fruitiness,” says Jason Shullo, the corporate director of beverage for Golden Entertainment, which operates casinos and resorts in Nevada and Maryland. It works well in bourbon-based drinks like Smashes, Cobblers or Juleps. In his nuanced version of an Old Fashioned, the bourbon plays up the liqueur’s peach notes while bitters temper its sweetness.

This recipe originally appeared as part of “What the #$@! Do I Do with This? Peach Schnapps. What It Is and How to Use It.”

Muddle the cherry, orange slice and bitters in a mixing glass.

Add the bourbon, schnapps and ice and stir until well-chilled.

Strain into a rocks glass over a large ice sphere.

Garnish with a dehydrated or fresh orange slice.
